item.title: Using the Neo4j Driver in Spring Boot
item.description: By choice, I’d normally steer clear of Java if I wanted to write a lightweight application, and instead write something with Node. But since joining Neo4j last summer, I’ve become exposed to Java on a daily basis, writing User Defined Functions & Procedures in Neo4j. However, since being introduced to Spring, I’ve been impressed by how quickly you can get a REST API up and running. Starting with Spring Intializr, and after a few @Annotations, you can have a production grade application with security up in minutes.
